free_text.Required prior knowledge: [li]Liner algebra[br/][li]Represent a linear system by a transfer function, A5[br/][li]Design a PID controller, A9 (Control Systems + TP)[br/][li]Design a simple controller for a dynamic system, A10 (Control Systems + TP)
free_text.Content: State of a system. Continuous-time state space model. Discrete-time state space model. Solution of the continuous-time state space equation. Solution of the discrete-time state equation. Sampling of a continuous-time state equation. Jordan canonical form. Controllability and observability. Controllability and observability canonical forms. Pole placement. State observer. Linear quadratic regulator.
free_text.Keywords: Digital control, state space modelling, system analysis in the state space, state space controller design
free_text.Type of teaching: Ex cathedra course, integrated demos and case studies
free_text.Learning outcomes: [b]Domain skills:[/b][br/][li]Linearize a nonlinear system, A3[br/][li]Analyze a linear dynamical system (both time and frequency responses), A4[br/][li]Represent a system by a linear or nonlinear state-space model, A6[br/][li]Construct and analyse a discrete-time model for a dynamic system, A7[br/][li]Analyse a multivariable dynamic system and design an appropriate controller for the system, A12[br/][li]Design an advanced controller for a dynamic system, A13[br/][li]Assess the stability, performance and robustness of a closed-loop system, A14[br/][li]Define (specifications) the adequate control performance for dynamic systems, A15[br/][li]Propose several control solutions, formulate the trade-offs, choose the options, A16[br/][li]Validate the performance (by simulations or experiments), A24[br/][li]Evaluate and discuss the performance and the solutions, and draw conclusions, A26[br/][b]Transversal skills:[/b][br/][li]Time management, T1[br/][li]Self-assessment of acquired skills, T2[br/][li]Analyse decisions in terms of subjective and objective aspects, T9[br/][li]Be perseverant through difficulties, T15[br/][li]Analyse the consequences of a decision or solution, T20
